qas.question: What program with a direction in its name does the BBC broadcast from Southampton?
What's the name of the local ITV division?
Where is the Meridian headquarters located?
What is the local television channel for Southampton called?
Towards the end of what year did That's Solent begin broadcasting?

context: Local media include the Southern Daily Echo newspaper based in Redbridge and BBC South, which has its regional headquarters in the city centre opposite the civic centre. From there the BBC broadcasts <a0_0>South Today<a0_0/>, the local television news bulletin and BBC Radio Solent. The local ITV franchise is <a1_0>Meridian<a1_0/>, which has its headquarters in <a2_0>Whiteley<a2_0/>, around nine miles (14 km) from the city. Until December 2004, the station's studios were located in the Northam area of the city on land reclaimed from the River Itchen. <a3_0>That's Solent<a3_0/> is an local television channel that began broadcasting in November <a4_0>2014<a4_0/>, which will be based in and serve Southampton and Portsmouth.
